exclusion:
WARNING: Service button S must NOT be used when module is connected to 110-230V power supply.

  • Connect module to power supply (with temperature sensor connected - if purchased),
  • Enable add/remove mode on main controller
  • Auto-inclusion (works for about 2 minutesafter connected to power supply) or
  • 110V-230V power supply: Press push button I1 three times within 3 seconds (3 times change switch state within 3 seconds)
  • 24V SELV: Press service button S for more than 2 seconds.

NOTE1: For auto-inclusion procedure, first set main controller into inclusion mode and then connect module to power supply.

NOTE2: When connecting temperature sensor to module that has already been included, you have to exclude module first. Switch off power supply,connect the sensor and re-include the module.
inclusion:
WARNING: Service button S must NOT be used when module is connected to 110-230V power supply.

  • Connect module to power supply (with temperature sensor connected - if purchased),
  • Enable add/remove mode on main controller
  • Auto-inclusion (works for about 2 minutesafter connected to power supply) or
  • 110V-230V power supply: Press push button I1 three times within 3 seconds (3 times change switch state within 3 seconds)
  • 24V SELV: Press service button S for more than 2 seconds.

NOTE1: For auto-inclusion procedure, first set main controller into inclusion mode and then connect module to power supply.

NOTE2: When connecting temperature sensor to module that has already been included, you have to exclude module first. Switch off power supply,connect the sensor and re-include the module.
label: Flush Dimmer
overview: This Z-Wave module is used for dimming the bulb or to manage the speed of a fan. The module can be controlled either through a Z-Wave network or through the wall switch. The module is designed to be mounted inside a "flush mounting box", hidden behind a traditional wall switch. Module measures power consumption of bulb or fan and supports connection of digital temperature sensor. It is designed to act as repeater in order to improve range and stability of Z-wave network.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON / ALL OFF
parameters.description: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF
parameters.overview: Flush dimmer module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.

options.label: ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameters.label: Automatic turning off output after set time
parameters.description: Auto OFF enabled with defined time, step is 1 second.

parameters.label: Automatic turning on output after set time
parameters.description: Auto ON enabled with defined time, step is 1 second.

parameters.label: Enable / Disable 3-way switch
parameters.description: Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1.
parameters.overview:
Dimming is done by push button or switch connected to I1 (by default).

Enabling 3way switch, dimming can be controlled by push button or switch connected to I1 and I2.

parameters.label: Enable / Disable Double click function
parameters.description: A fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum.
parameters.overview: If Double click function is enabled, a fast double click on the push button will set dimming power at maximum dimming value.

parameters.label: Saving the state after a power failure
parameters.description: Saving the state after a power failure
parameters.overview:
If state saving is enabled, flush dimmer module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure).

If state saving is disabled, flush dimmer module does not save the state after a power failure.

parameters.label: Power reporting in watts on power change
parameters.description: Set value is percentage, set value from 0 - 100 = 0% - 100%.
parameters.overview:
Set value means percentage, set value from 0 - 100 = 0% - 100%. Default value is 5.

  • 0 – Reporting Disabled
  • 1 – 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled.

Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.

NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set.

parameters.label: Power reporting in Watts by time interval
parameters.description: Set value means time interval (0 – 32767) in seconds.
parameters.overview:
Set value means time interval (0 – 32767) in seconds, when power report is sent.

  • 0 – reporting disabled
  • 1 – 32767 = 1 second – 32767 seconds. Reporting enabled.

Power report is send with time interval set by entered value.

parameters.label: Minimum dimming value
parameters.description: Minimum dimming value is set by entered value.
parameters.overview:
• 1-98 = 1% – 98%, step is 1%. Minimum dimming value is set by entered value.

NOTE: The minimum level may not be higher than the maximum level! 1% min. dimming value is defined by Z- Wave multilevel device class.

parameters.label: Maximum dimming value
parameters.description: Maximum dimming value is set by entered value.
parameters.overview:
• 2-99 = 2% – 99%, step is 1%. Maximum dimming value is set by entered value.

NOTE: The maximum level may not be lower than the minimum level! 99% max. dimming value is defined by Z- Wave multilevel device class.

parameters.label: Dimming time (soft on/off)
parameters.description: Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values
parameters.overview:
Set value means time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max. dimming values by short press of push button I1 or controlled through UI (BasicSet).

  • default value 100 = 1s
  • 1 - 255 = 100 mseconds – 25500 mseconds, step is 10 mseconds

parameters.label: Dimming time when key pressed
parameters.description: Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values
parameters.overview:
Time of moving the Dimmer between min. and max dimming values by continuous hold of push button I1 or associated device.

  • default value 3 = 3s
  • 1- 255 = 1 second – 255 seconds.

parameters.label: Ignore start level
parameters.description: This parameter is used with association group 3
parameters.overview: This parameter is used with association group 3. A receiving device SHOULD respect the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 0. A receiving device MUST ignore the start level if the Ignore Start Level bit is 1.

parameters.label: Dimming duration
parameters.description: This parameter is used with association group 3
parameters.overview: This parameter is used with association group 3. The Duration field MUST specify the time that the transition should take from the current value to the new target value. A supporting device SHOULD respect the specified Duration value.

parameters.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I2
parameters.description: Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI.
parameters.overview:
Enabling I2 means that Endpoint (I2) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint.

NOTE1: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re include the module!

NOTE 2: When the parameter is set to value 9 the notifications are send for Home Security.

parameters.label: Enable / Disable Endpoints I3
parameters.description: Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI.
parameters.overview:
Enabling I3 means that Endpoint (I3) will be present on UI. Disabling it will result in hiding the endpoint according to the parameter set value. Additionally, a Notification Type and Event can be selected for the endpoint.

NOTE1: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re include the module!

NOTE 2: When the parameter is set to value 9 the notifications are send for Home Security.

parameters.label: Temperature sensor offset settings
parameters.overview:
Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor. Available configuration parameters:

  • default value 32536
  • 32536 – offset is 0.0C
  • From 1 to 100 – value from 0.1 °C to 10.0 °C is added to actual measured temperature.
  • From 1001 to 1100 -value from -0.1 °C to -10.0 °C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.

parameters.label: Digital temperature sensor reporting
parameters.description: Module reports measured temperature on defined temperature change
parameters.overview:
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter. Available configuration parameters:

  • default value 5 = 0.5°C
  • 0 – Reporting disabled

parameters.label: Unsecure / Secure Inclusion
parameters.overview: The Flush dimmer supports both, the secure and unsecure inclusion. Even if the controller does not support security command classes, a dimmer could be included as unsecure and keep all the functionality

associations.label: I1 basic on/off
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I1 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: I1 start/stop level change
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I1 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: Multilevel
associations.description: Triggered at changes of state/value of the Flush Dimmer

associations.label: I2 basic on/off
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: I2 notification report
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: I2 binary sensor
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: I3 basic on/off
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: I3 notification report
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: I3 binary sensor
associations.description: Triggered at change of the input I3 state and reflecting its state

associations.label: Multilevel sensor
associations.description: Triggered at change of temperature sensor
